intro: Christella timorensis, commonly known as the Timor Christella, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in horticultural trade.
